title: French elections: Which parties refused tactical withdrawals to beat the RN?
summary: Thirty-three candidates in a position to block the far-right Rassemblement National refused to drop out. Behind this choice lie several reasons: vote transfer calculations, distrust of the left, and some atypical situations.

title: French elections: 224 candidates have officially withdrawn from the second round
summary: The official list of candidates for the second round shows that 224 eligible candidates have dropped out, most of them to help beat the far right.

title: French elections: Could there be an anti-RN governing coalition, from the Greens to the right?
summary: Should the far right fall short of an absolute majority, Prime Minister Gabriel Attal floated the idea of building an unprecedented coalition in the history of France's Fifth Republic, to avoid gridlock.

title: French elections: 'For the last two weeks, I've been doing exercise to calm myself down, but also in the belief that we're entering an era of combat'
summary: 'Le Monde' spoke to people from across France about their personal hopes and fears in the run-up to the second round of snap elections that could see the far right reach power. Today, 48-year-old Jérôme Grillon, an animated film director from Paris.

title: French elections: Far right embarrassed by candidate's racist remarks about dual nationals
summary: Daniel Grenon, a far-right Rassemblement National candidate running for re-election, said during a debate that French citizens who also have a North African nationality should not be appointed as ministers. His party claims it was an 'erroneous' quote, though it was confirmed via a recording.

title: Can the French president make appointments without the prime minister?
summary: President Emmanuel Macron has recently appointed a wave of senior civil servants, anticipating a possible electoral victory of the far-right Rassemblement National. Marine Le Pen has accused him of wanting to prevent the RN from governing, if victorious.

title: 'No one’s pushing me out': Biden vows to keep running despite growing pressure to quit race
summary: Pressure has mounted on the veteran Democrat following his debate performance against Donald Trump.

title: In Sweden, concern grows over anti-Muslim hate incidents
summary: Testimonies abound of regular insults and attacks against Muslims, fueled in recent years by a dehumanizing public rhetoric.

title: Centre Pompidou's museum project in New Jersey suffers setback
summary: Rising costs and a local political clash are jeopardizing the construction of the Parisian museum's American branch.

title: A small town dreams of restoring the UK's oldest railway station for its 200th anniversary
summary: In the northeast of England, an organization is rallying to raise funds for Heighington Station, located on the world's first railway line, which will celebrate its bicentenary in 2025.

title: Tour de France: Cavendish breaks Merckx's record with 35th stage win
summary: The 39-year-old Mark Cavendish overtakes the legendary Belgian's record for most stage wins in the Tour de France.

title: Hurricane Beryl, an extraordinary phenomenon wreaking havoc in the Caribbean
summary: This unusually violent storm has claimed seven lives in the southeast of the Caribbean archipelago and is threatening Jamaica.

title: French elections: How the 224 candidate withdrawals have reshaped the second round
summary: Calls for candidates not to stand in races where the RN could win have been complied with by almost everyone on the left, and to a lesser extent by Macron supporters.

title: UK tabloid 'The Sun' backs Labour in election
summary: The major tabloid said it was 'time for Labour,' endorsing the opposition party for election victory and calling the ruling Conservatives 'exhausted' and divided.

title: UK general election: Rishi Sunak gets surprise support from Boris Johnson as vote looms
summary: The ousted scandal-ridden former prime minister made a surprise show of support for the incumbent British leader ahead of general elections on July 4.

title: Biden challenged in polls and by fellow Democrats after Trump debate debacle
summary: A member of Congress called on US President Joe Biden to withdraw on Tuesday, after post-debate polls showed VP Kamala Harris with the best chance of beating Donald Trump. The president's camp remains in denial.

title: France asks two Chinese spies to leave after attempt to forcibly repatriate man
summary: The top official in Paris of the Ministry of State Security, the Chinese intelligence agency, and his deputy have been asked to leave the country.

title: French elections: Sharp rise in voter turnout mostly benefited the far right and Macron's camp
summary: In the first round of snap parliamentary elections on June 30, the president's coalition of parties attracted 2.8 million more votes than in the June 9 European elections, as did the Rassemblement National and its allies. The left, on the other hand, gained only 1.2 million votes.

title: Eight anti-fascist activists under investigation after attacking a minor
summary: Alleged members of the group Jeune Garde attacked a young man they suspected of being a member of the Jewish Defense League. They have been placed under judicial supervision for 'group violence on the grounds of race, ethnicity or religion.'

title: EU taxes Ukrainian exports of eggs, oats and sugar
summary: Europeans opened their borders to Ukrainian agricultural products after the Russian invasion. But faced with farmers' anger in several member states, they decided to restrict this preferential treatment.

title: UK general election: The cheerful campaign of Ed Davey, leader of Britain's Liberal Democrats
summary: In a swimsuit in the Thames, on a giant slide or on a roller coaster, the 58-year-old MP has attempted to win over the British public in an offbeat style, ahead of the July 4 general election.

title: The Central African Republic, Rwanda's land of opportunity
summary: The Kagame regime has become a key player in the UN peacekeeping mission and is stepping up its economic presence in its neighboring country, where it shares the exploitation of natural resources with the Russians.

title: French elections: What Europe's latest financial crises have taught us
summary: The market reaction to recent tremors – financial panic in the UK generated by the Liz Truss government and tensions with the Italian government in 2018 – is a reminder that the arrival of a Rassemblement National government or an unclear majority is likely to lead to rate hikes.

title: What's the latest on the Crimean battle between Ukraine and Russia?
summary: Since the arrival of American long-range ATACMS missiles, the Ukrainian army has claimed to be decimating Russian air defenses in Crimea as part of a campaign to cut off its logistical routes.

title: French film director Jacquot charged with rape
summary: Benoît Jacquot is charged with raping actors Isild Le Besco and Julia Roy. Jacquot has denied all accusations.

title: Macron and Biden's last supper before the double debacle
summary: On June 8, Emmanuel Macron welcomed Joe Biden to the Elysée Palace for a sumptuous dinner. It was a perfect evening, yet a double catastrophe was brewing: The Frenchman's decision to call early elections, leading the far right to the doorstep of power, and the American's disastrous debate against Donald Trump.

title: UK general election: Labour tipped for historic win as voters go to polls
summary: The party is projected to win its first general election since 2005, with a flurry of election-eve polls all forecasting its biggest-ever victory. That would almost certainly put Labour leader Keir Starmer, 61, in Downing Street.

title: Roland Dumas, former French foreign affairs minister and Constitutional Council president, has died
summary: The son of a Resistance member and a long-time close associate of François Mitterrand, this flamboyant and controversial lawyer was forced to leave the limelight in 2000, due to his involvement in a scandal. He died at age 101 on July 3, 2024.

title: Hurricane Beryl roars toward Mexico after killing at least seven
summary: Mexico was preparing for the arrival of this Category Four hurricane on Thursday, after it it left destruction and a number of fatalities in its wake in the Caribbean.

title: French elections: What are the possible outcomes of the second round?
summary: After the final vote on July 7, the presidential camp is likely to lose its majority in the Assemblée Nationale, which has been relative since 2022. Several outcomes are possible.

title: Modi pursues authoritarian policies in India, despite harsh criticism from own camp
summary: Weakened at the polls, the Indian prime minister is being criticized even within his own nationalist organization, the RSS, for his 'arrogance' and 'undignified' campaign.

title: French elections: The other Marine taking center stage on the left
summary: The leader of France's Green party and veteran campaigner against the far right has been a key player in both the creation of the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance and the defense of a republican front against the RN.

title: French elections: New generation of left-wing activists emerges against the far right
summary: With just a few days to go before the second round of voting, novices who've never taken part in political campaigns are going out in the field to convince voters to block the far right.

title: Wembanyama and Gobert kick off Les Bleus' Olympic basketball preparations with a bang
summary: In their first game of the summer, the French national team came from behind to beat Turkey 96-46 in Rouen on Wednesday.

title: Gazan orphans face suffering beyond territory's borders
summary: Between 15,000 and 25,000 children have lost at least one parent, according to estimates by Palestinian civil society, as aid organizations struggle to help them find foster families.

title: French elections: Putin's Russia backs far-right Rassemblement National
summary: The Russian Foreign Ministry hopes that the far-right party will govern France. French intelligence services are worried about what an RN win on July 7 would mean.

title: French elections: Government spokesperson attacked on campaign trail
summary: Prisca Thevenot, her deputy and a party activist were putting up electoral posters near Paris on Wednesday night when a group attacked them.

title: French ultra-right website calls for 'elimination' lawyers who signed letter against RN
summary: The Paris Bar Council referred the matter to prosecutors after the website published the names of lawyers who had signed an open letter denouncing the far-right party on Wednesday.

title: Seine water quality improves, three weeks ahead of Paris Olympics
summary: The previous week, levels of E.Coli – a bacteria indicating the presence of fecal matter – had been above the upper limits used by sports federations every day at the Alexandre III bridge location in central Paris.
